doc.title: ANTA Sports Products Ltd
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/Anta 1H Results Mixed Signals - Solid H1 Performance Meets Cautious H2 Outlook. Investment Phase Begins.Anta 1H Results _2025-08-28

passages.text: ANTA delivered a solid 1H 2025 performance that masked increasing headwinds facing the business. While the first half showed impressive double- digit revenue growth and stable underlying profitability, the outlook for Q3 and 2H appears challenging. Management has acknowledged deteriorating retail conditions in July and August, and downgraded ANTA brand growth expectations for the second half. The company is clearly in an investment phase across multiple fronts – integrating the loss- making Jack Wolfskin acquisition, expanding new store formats, building emerging brands like Maia Active, and accelerating international expansion. These initiatives, while strategically sound for the long- term, will likely pressure both topline growth and margins in the near term, and when valuations have risen to from 14.5x to 18x due to Amer's outperformance.

ANTA Sports delivered decent results for 1H25, revenue grew \(14.3\%\) YoY. A slight beat on both revenue and earnings. The ANTA brand grew \(5.4\%\) , FILA up \(8.6\%\) , and other brands \(61.1\%\) . E- commerce mix is now \(34.8\%\) of total revenue and growing \(17.6\%\) vs. LY. Despite the margin pressures, ANTA's OPM improved \(0.6\%\) to \(26.3\%\) . GPM declined slightly by \(0.7\%\) to \(63.4\%\) , reflecting e- commerce expansion across the ANTA and FILA brands. NPM stood at \(18.2\%\) , down \(4.7\%\) YoY, though this comparison is affected by a one- time gain in 1H24 from the Amer Sports listing. Excluding this and other one- time items, underlying profit grew \(14.5\%\) , maintaining a stable \(18.2\%\) margin.

Investments in brands and international expansion: The company completed the strategic acquisition of JACK WOLFSKIN in May 2025 for RMB2.16 billion. However, in the near term, contributing to overall business will remain limited. The company is implementing a 3- 5 year revitalization plan for JACK WOLFSKIN, expecting initial losses of more than RMB100million in 2025. Additionally, ANTA formed a strategic JV and invested \(40\%\) stake in Wuxing, a fashion brand in Korea. ANTA continues to make progress in its global expansion strategy, with international sales for the ANTA brand growing over \(100\%\) , particularly in Southeast Asia, the Middle East, and Africa. [Continued to next page]

[Continued from front page]

Downward revision on ANTA brand guidance: from high- single- digit to mid- single- digit growth due to retail challenges observed in July and August. Conversely, raised growth guidance for DESCENTE and KOLON SPORT from \(30\%\) to \(40\% +\) based on their strong performance. Overall company FY guidance remains largely unchanged (Exhibit 2).
ANTA returned value to shareholders through an interim dividend of HK137 cents per share, maintaining a \(50.2\%\) payout ratio, and conducted RMB1.04 billion in share repurchases during the period.

We updated our model and adjusted down our forecasts slightly on margin concerns driven by investments needed ahead. Maintaining \(15x \text{NTM} + 1\) earnings, we derive our new TP at 95HKD, implying \(6\%\) downside. The modest TP increase is driven by \(\text{NTM} + 1\) earnings rolling forward.
Investment ImplicationsWe rate Anta Market- Perform.
EXHIBIT 1: Anta 1H25 results

EXHIBIT 2: Anta 2025 guidance changes

BrandRevenue guideMargin guideAnta brand2025 growth decrease from HSD to MSD2025 maintains OPM at 20-25%Fila brand2025 maintains MSD growth2025 maintains OPM at 25%Descente and Kolon brands2025 growth increase from 30%+ to 40%+Improve from 2024
Source: Company earnings call. Bernstein analysis

- Jack Wolfskin making development plan for 3-5 years; many low-efficiency stores- This year won't see contribution from the brand; there will be loss contributions- Maia base is now established, but not too many operating metrics available- There may be even some losses from Maia

- Policy remains the same, but there are regional differences- Anta and Fila receive more subsidies given their business registration in Fujian- Government subsidies are included in reported figures- Anta brand received most subsidies; GPM came down 1.7%, NPM came up 1.5%- Excluding subsidies, NPM decline should be around 0.5% instead- GPM affected as online sale mix increased and online discount is more difficult to control
- Jack Wolfskin was grouped with other brands- Expenses related to HQ were separately accounted for

Fashion company with synergies between sports, fashion, and new retail formats Preparing for the future; they're doing well in Korea Anta's mid and back office strengths (IT, financials) will provide support Investment of a few hundred million, \(40\%\) shareholding, strategic investment into fashion Wuxing has 29 stores in Korea with good membership; plan to open stores in China by year- end Anta will provide back office support while Wuxing focuses on operations Future profit sharing arrangement will be implemented

Q: ANTA CORE BRAND OPM EXCLUDING GOVT SUBSIDIES, WILL INVEST MORE IN 2H? NEW STORE FORMATS, WILL THEY CONTINUE? HOW WILL ANTA OPM IMPROVE IN 2H? FOR SUPER ANTA, KEY GROWTH DRIVER MILESTONE, WHERE ARE THEY IN THE OVERALL BRAND STRATEGY? PAYOUT TO MINORITY SHAREHOLDERS OF OTHER BRANDS, ANY THOUGHTS TO ACHIEVE FURTHER ENHANCEMENTS?

Q: ANTA CORE BRAND OPM EXCLUDING GOVT SUBSIDIES, WILL INVEST MORE IN 2H? NEW STORE FORMATS, WILL THEY CONTINUE? HOW WILL ANTA OPM IMPROVE IN 2H? FOR SUPER ANTA, KEY GROWTH DRIVER MILESTONE, WHERE ARE THEY IN THE OVERALL BRAND STRATEGY? PAYOUT TO MINORITY SHAREHOLDERS OF OTHER BRANDS, ANY THOUGHTS TO ACHIEVE FURTHER ENHANCEMENTS?  - 16- 17% OPM excluding subsidies, higher versus last year  - GPM came down for Anta, but improved cost efficiency (e.g., AMP % improved)  - Focus remains on long- term growth  - Making a loss in U.S. market for 2- 3 years already, but maintaining exposure to many markets  - OPM should not fluctuate too much while investing for the future  - Super Anta should achieve certain scale with high- quality stores; last year's stores not totally satisfactory, this year's openings are better  - Will control the rhythm of expansion

Guidance has been revised Retail sell- through guidance does not include Jack Wolfskin Other brands category includes Jack Wolfskin for one month No revenue for Jack Wolfskin in financials yet June and 2H will show a loss from Jack Wolfskin

Q: ELABORATE ON ANTA'S NEW BUSINESS FORMATS, OVERALL VOLUMES, GAP FROM CORE BRANDS, INFLUENCE OF NEW STORE FORMAT, STORE COUNTS, MAIN DIRECTION?  - Champion is more mature with 100+ stores; productivity high at 500,000 RMB or higher  - Dynamic management year after year; targeting 200 Champion stores first (similar to Kolon and Descent's current footprint)  - Other brands positioned in high- end channels (e.g., Nanjing Rd, Xintiandi) targeting younger customers  - Super Anta still needs time, maybe 400- 500 stores eventually  - Product structure needs adjustment; first 100 stores will serve as test  - Traditional Anta reaches different consumers with different products across thousands of stores  - Different store tiers (e.g., arena stores) with average store productivity at 700k- 800k

Q: MULTIPLE BRANDS SHARE, PROFESSIONAL CATEGORY SHARE, FOOTWEAR SHARE, APPAREL SHARE, FOR ANTA AND FILA, WHAT ARE THE CHANGES?  - Anta brand: footwear/apparel ratio same as last year  - Functional products (running shoes) maintain share; basketball shoes showing HSD share  - PG series sold 2 million of units within half a year  - Products seeing good international reception; product mix is richer now  - Basketball performing average, but shoe share is steady; sponsorships expected to enhance share  - Professional category for Anta introduced in 2019, now has more functionality in products
- For outdoor brands, online growth is the same as offline- Descent and Kolon growing more organically; will not increase growth rate by lowering prices

- Focus on better online consumer experience- Anta and Fila online growth rate is faster and reached high level- Profit margin and expense rate level is already high; trying to strike a balance- During 618 shopping festival, Anta brand did not reach retail sell-through target due to increasing discounts- E-commerce share for Anta and Fila is approximately \(30\%\) - Descent and Kolon online share is \(20\%\) or less- Anta: Footwear is \(53\%\) of mix, larger than apparel- Fila: Footwear share is lower but performing well- Anta is a mass brand; cannot differentiate online vs. offline consumer behavior

- No additional drivers needed for growth currently- Will increase investments while maintaining profit margins- \(33.2\%\) OPM from Descent- Maia, plus one month of Jack Wolfskin, showed good growth in GPM- Usually 2H OPM is lower than 1H- Main momentum in high growth rate should continue

- July and August worse than Q1; this week slightly better than earlier in August- Need to continue monitoring conditions- For Anta brand, revised guidance from HSD to MSD; will work hard to achieve MSD- Retail sell-through was weak in July and August; GPM under pressure- 2H approach will be more prudent and cautious- July and August likely the worst months (traditionally low season)- Conditions apply similarly to both Anta and Fila; other brands on low base doing okay

- Store count will be stable; smaller stores converting to bigger formats- Each brand showing good performance in store productivity (revenue per store)- Anta around 300k, kids 100k, increasing for Fila- Fila core brand 1m, kids and fusion 300k-400k- Descent 2.5m and Kolon 2m- Store productivity is a key driver for new business format development

- June: Few tens of millions in losses for one month- Estimate total losses to be 100-200 million this year- One-off costs from being spun off from the group company- Business integration, consolidation, and empowerment ongoing- Expect to control overall profitability after initial costs- Effective tax rate: corporate profit tax is steady; increase is in dividend tax- Subsidiary dividend and overseas business including Jack Wolfskin incurred expenses- 2H profit tax rate expected to increase
- Q1 good, Q2 weak, Q3 weaker- This week showing improvement but no strong recovery signs yet- Revised revenue guidance for 2H
- Profit margin difficult to forecast accurately- Retail discount levels will determine profit; using dynamic judgment
- Subsidies follow profit growth but timing between 1H and 2H is unpredictable- Usually there is an increase every year

- Difficult to separate the disclosure; 3-5 year plan not yet formulated- Takes time to nurture the brand- Jack Wolfskin revenue this year expected to be same as before- Last year had many challenges (inventory management, channel issues)- Focus on healthy growth; may discontinue underperforming channels- Overall impact not expected to be significant- HQ expenses are charged to the brands- HQ expenses in 1H24 were lower than budget, resulting in profit- In 1H25, revenue and expenses were largely the same- The 1H HQ expense of 228mn was fully accounted for

Overall, ANTA Group continues to outperform the broader sports apparel market through its multi- brand strategy, delivering \(14\% +\) growth in 1H 2025 despite challenging retail conditions where the industry grew only \(3\%\) , while maintaining strong profit margins (20- 25% OPM for ANTA brand, 25% for FILA); the company is strategically investing in retail format innovation (Champion, SV, and Super ANTA stores), category expansion in basketball and running, accelerating international expansion in Southeast Asia, Middle East and Western markets with \(100\% +\) growth, and making targeted acquisitions like Jack Wolfskin while upgrading guidance for emerging brands from \(30\%\) to \(40\%\) growth, all supporting management's confidence in long- term market leadership despite near- term headwinds in July- August.
- Strong 1H Performance:
- 1H grew \(14\% +\) which is a strong achievement given our very big base
- All our brands achieved double-digit growth, increasing market share
- Overall apparel and footwear market up only \(3\%\) in 1H
- Companies with 10B+ revenue typically delivered around \(20\%\) growth
- Multi-brand system proving valuable in challenging conditions
- July and August presenting bigger challenges in retail
- Performance weaker compared to Q1
- Expectations are lower for this period
- Starting September, we anticipate improvements
- Last week's data shows better attainment rates than earlier periods
- Brand-Specific Guidance:
- ANTA: 1H achieved MSD growth; 2H guidance revised from HSD to MSD; FY maintaining MSD guidance
- DESCENTE and KOLON SPORT: Guidance revised from 30% to 40%+ based on strong 1H
- Growth brands continuing strong with 50% growth in July/August
- Remain optimistic about Chinese sports market's long-term development
- Confident we will continue to outperform the industry as a whole

Q: Q2 MARKET PRESSURE BIG, ANTA IS DOING BETTER THAN OTHER BIG BRANDS. SO FOR 2H FOR CORE BRANDS WHAT ARE THE MEASURES TO ACHIEVEMENT? THE BRAND PERFORMANCE IS GOOD FOR NEW BRANDS. WHAT IS THE LONG TERM PLANS FOR THESE BRANDS? PROFIT MARGIN PERFORMANCE FOR 2H, YOU MENTIONED 20-22% OPM GUIDANCE, WILL YOU KEEP THIS NUMBER?
- 1H industry had large overall volume but low growth rate, especially in Q2
- ANTA brand outperformed peers despite not completing all targets
- 1H shortfalls included shifts in products on emerging e-commerce during 618 shopping festival
- 2H Improvement Strategies:
- Enhanced online cultivation with better performance expected
- Earlier preparation for 11/11 shopping festival
- Adjustments to franchise/wholesale market to address competition and declining foot traffic
- Vertical innovation to reach more consumer groups (initiative started last year)
- Store Format Innovation Success:
- Champion stores: RMB500,000+ productivity, opened 17 stores in 1H, sponsored HK trail races
- 10 new Champion stores opened in 1H (62 total), higher productivity than traditional formats
- SV stores: Younger consumers, sports fusion concept, successful in business districts
- Super ANTA: Mass-market format, 17 stores across many provinces, good performance
- Additional new formats launched with early achievements
- Margin Performance:
- GPM declined but improvements in other areas
- Cost reduction and efficiency initiatives delivered OPM improvement
- New business formats require investment before scale benefits materialize- ANTA brand OPM guidance maintained at 20-25%

- Brand Positioning & Strategy:- FILA positioning is high-end athleisure- Did well during 6.18 shopping festival and strengthened channel deployment- Strengthened mindshare with consumers- This year, FILA Golf and Tennis are key categories- Built differentiated barrier; now recognized as leader vs. average mindshare previously- Refocused on middle-class consumers using quality products- Resource allocation prioritizes product quality and consumer stickiness- Management Approach:- Management efficiency provided strong momentum- Culture of "willing a battle" activating team vitality- Focus on effectiveness and consistency this year- New FILA team with new CEO (since January 1st)- Four Key Success Factors:- Industry vertical remains strong- Effective DTC business model- Broad product range (kids, fusion to sports, full family)- Strong resource investment in brand/product development- Profit Margin Outlook:- 1H GPM and OPM didn't put pressure on teams- Previous success due to brand strength and retail model- Retail discounts impact GPM as key factor- Short-term pressures: competition, destocking, product development- With continued adjustments, margins will return to ideal levels- GPM to be maintained at reasonable level
- OPM guidance around \(25\%\) - Strong future confidence

Q: MR. DING, OVER THE YEARS HAS BEEN TALKING ABOUT HIGH QUALITY DEVELOPMENT. 1H ANTA GROWTH 1.5% FOR OPM GROWTH, HIGHER THAN EXPECTATIONS. IN TERMS OF HIGH QUALITY AND GROWTH, FOR ANTA CORE BRAND CAN YOU MAKE INVESTMENT? BASKETBALL NOT PERFORMING WELL. ANTA CORE BRAND HAS MORE DNA IN BASKETBALL, WHAT DO YOU PLAN TO DO?

- Multi-brand approach remains strongest strategy- ANTA is the core mother brand, needs continued improvement- Mass product large scale brands typically show slower overall growth- Profit margin currently balanced; OPM not improved due to long-term investment focus- Significant innovation investment for ANTA brand- Product improvements through innovation provide foundation for sustainable growth- Basketball Category:- Signed multiple team collaborations this year- Will continue to improve basketball offerings- M&A Strategy:- High success rate in acquisitions- Not sequential in acquiring brands - opportunistic approach- Strategic direction (multi-brand) guides acquisition targets- Some targets are "可遇不可求" (can be encountered but not sought)- ANTA Group now more mature in approach

- Guidance Update:- Raising other brands guidance from \(30\%\) to \(40\%\) - Descente and Kolon expected to perform better in second half than first half- Performance Metrics:- Enhanced store productivity (2M RMB is considered good in China)- Major breakthrough in Eastern and Southern China

- Improved multiple indicators beyond just sales scale- High quarterly sell-out rates- Success Factors:- Core strengths: 1) Merchandise quality 2) Brand positioning- Strong brand management teams- Leveraging group's outdoor brand expertise- Future Outlook:- Kolon and Descente expected to outperform industry over next 2-3 years

- Acquisition Rationale:- Admiration for the brand's DNA- Brand's valuable outdoor experience positioning in China market- Management & Integration:- Organized management structure with new CEO- 3-5 year revitalization plan being implemented- September next year: reshape and rebrand Jack Wolfskin- Systematic market introduction planned- Focus on sports footwear and apparel- Investment Structure:- Not the controlling shareholder- Will benefit from ANTA's supply chain- Wuxing will benefit from the partnership- Structured as minority investment
- Current Performance:- Amer Sports Group maintained strong 1H growth momentum- Strong foundation established for future development
- Core strength is innovative products- Two key categories performing well: outdoor sneakers and outdoor performance- Both categories achieving good consumer recognition
- China and APAC are fastest growing regions globally- Europe remains biggest market with important 1H breakthroughs- Strategic cooperation with JD Sports and other key European retail channels

- Effective specialty store expansion- Annual store count to reach 290- Independent stores opened in Paris, London and Milan- Strong results in mainstream retail channels- Unique positioning in sneaker category, especially for young female consumers- Mid-to-long term store expansion to drive growth
- Strategic Balance:
- Balancing development needs with shareholder returns
- Maintaining liquidity for growth stage investments
- Need agility to seize M&A opportunities
- Maintaining 50% dividend payout ratio
- Amer Sports contribution growing but no cash dividend from them yet
- Looking at attributable profit excluding Amer until dividend policy changes
- Taking responsible approach to shareholder returns
- Already repurchased RMB 2 billion worth of shares

Q: ANTA CORE BRAND OVERSEAS DEVELOPMENT: 1H MADE SOME MOVES, SHARE PERFORMANCE. STRATEGIES FOR BEST SELLING PRODUCTS, CHANNEL AND MARKET DISTRIBUTIONS. ANTA HAS LEADING MARKET SHARE IN 1H, IN THE FUTURE, BESIDES INNOVATION IN RETAIL FORMAT, WHAT ARE THE PRODUCT/CATEGORIES THAT WILL PERFORM BETTER TO IMPROVE MARKET SHARE?
- International Expansion:

- International Expansion:- Started SEA branch in 2023- Expanding into Middle East and European markets this year- 1H growth rate exceeded 100%- Developed more complete business model and retail layout- Middle East team established; represents second major growth point- Product structure still evolving; future will bring more differentiated products- Partnering with local collaborators in new markets- Western Markets Strategy:- EU/US approach combines retail channels and online presence- PG7 performing well in Western markets with higher ASP than China- LA flagship store opening planned- EU/US strategy includes global marketing initiatives- Continued investment needed but clear strategy in place- Product & Retail Innovation:- Expanded category matrices (e.g., diverse running shoe options)- Previous limitations in style variety now addressed- Super ANTA store format enables convenient access to professional sports products- Larger formats accommodate more categories, sports gear, equipment and cross-products- Combined category expansion and new formats reaching broader consumer base
- High ratio of direct customers, maintaining current level- Future profitability expected to remain consistent with current performance

- Group Revenue: Increased \(14.3\%\) YoY to RMB38,544 million- ANTA Brand: Up \(5.4\%\) to RMB16,950 million, driven by e-commerce growth and enhanced product functionality- FILA Brand: Up \(8.6\%\) to RMB14,182 million, supported by e-commerce and functional/footwear products- Other Brands: Surged \(61.1\%\) to RMB7,412 million, led by outstanding performance from DESCENTE and KOLON SPORT- E-Commerce Contribution: Reached \(34.8\%\) of total revenue (up from \(33.8\%\) ), growing \(17.6\%\) YoY through enhanced channel mix and digitization
- Gross Profit Margin: Decreased \(0.7\mathrm{pp}\) to \(63.4\%\)

- ANTA segment: Down \(1.7\mathrm{pp}\) to \(54.9\%\) due to performance product investments and e-commerce expansion- FILA segment: Down \(2.2\mathrm{pp}\) to \(68.0\%\) from product enhancement costs and strategic shift to footwear
- Operating Profit Margin: Improved \(0.6\mathrm{pp}\) to \(26.3\%\)
- ANTA segment: Up \(1.5\mathrm{pp}\) to \(23.3\%\) through operational refinements
- FILA segment: Down \(0.9\mathrm{pp}\) to \(27.7\%\) due to product mix changes
- Net Profit Margin: \(18.2\%\) , down \(4.7\mathrm{pp}\) YoY (due to one-time gain in 1H 2024 from Amer Sports listing)
- Underlying Profit Growth: Excluding one-time items, profit up \(14.5\%\) to RMB7,031 million with stable \(18.2\%\) margin
- Staff Costs: Ratio to revenue increased slightly by \(0.2\mathrm{pp}\) , with total costs up \(15.6\%\) to RMB6,043 million
- Marketing Efficiency: Advertising to revenue ratio decreased \(0.9\mathrm{pp}\) , reflecting improved ROI
- R&D Investment: Ratio to revenue decreased slightly by \(0.1\mathrm{pp}\) while maintaining product innovation
- Inventory Management: Write-down of RMB38 million (vs. reversal of RMB276 million in 1H 2024)
- Receivables Quality: Impairment loss of RMB35 million (vs. RMB1 million in 1H 2024)
- Cash Balance: RMB9,656 million, down RMB1,734 million from December 2024
- Cash Flow Breakdown:

- Operating inflow: RMB10,931 million, demonstrating strong cash generation- Investing outflow: RMB7,745 million, including JACK WOLFSKIN acquisition (RMB2,164 million)- Financing outflow: RMB4,831 million, including dividends and share repurchases- Balance Sheet: Total assets of RMB118,235 million with shareholder equity of RMB63,769 million
- Gearing Ratio: \(20.3\%\) (up from \(18.5\%\) in December 2024)
- Interim Dividend: HK137 cents per share (RMB3,532 million total)- Payout Ratio: \(50.2\%\) of profit attributable to equity shareholders- Share Repurchases: RMB1,035 million during the period

- Multi-Brand Success: Continued execution of differentiated multi-brand strategy strengthened competitive advantages and market leadership- Portfolio Performance: Cornerstone brands (ANTA, FILA) delivered steady growth while emerging brands (DESCENTE, KOLON SPORT) achieved rapid expansion- Market Context: Outperformed broader consumer market despite headwinds; international competitors showing slowed momentum- Financial Achievement: \(14.3\%\) revenue growth to RMB38.54 billion with improved operating profit margin of \(26.3\%\) (up 0.6pp) despite slight gross margin decline- Bottom-Line Growth: Profit attributable to shareholders increased \(14.5\%\) to RMB7.03 billion (excluding one-time gains)

- ANTA: Revenue up \(5.4\%\) to RMB16.95 billion with operating margin improvement of 1.5pp to \(23.3\%\); progress in globalization strategy injecting new momentum- FILA: Revenue up \(8.6\%\) to RMB14.18 billion with \(27.7\%\) operating margin; particularly strong in tennis, golf, women's categories and outdoor segments- Other Brands Portfolio: Revenue surged \(61.1\%\) to RMB7.41 billion with substantial margin expansion of 3.3pp to \(33.2\%\) - DESCENTE: Achieved satisfactory growth through product innovation and high-efficiency store model- KOLON SPORT: Emerged as fastest-growing brand within Group, capitalizing on outdoor sports market with focus on hiking and camping- MAIA ACTIVE: Built specialized presence in women's yoga market through tailored Asian fit products- JACK WOLFSKIN: Strategic acquisition completed in May 2025 to enhance global outdoor market presence

- Channel Contribution: E-commerce reached \(34.8\%\) of total revenue (up from \(33.8\%\) ) with \(17.6\%\) YoY growth- Platform Strategy: Executed tailored marketing across diverse platforms including live-streaming, short-form video, and traditional e-commerce- Data Advantage: Leveraged advanced CRM systems and algorithmic models to enhance personalization and conversion rates
- Ecosystem Development: Continued building Sports Industry Innovation Consortium connecting \(60+\) universities, \(10+\) research institutions, and \(3,000+\) suppliers
- Advanced R&D: Established Humanoid Robot Sports Science Joint Research Base with Unitree Robotics
- AI Implementation: Embedded AI across business functions:

- Digital motion capture systems for elite athlete equipment development- "Shark-skin" skating suit with \(5 - 10\%\) reduced wind resistance- AI-assisted design system reducing development time from months to days- Automated inventory management and personalized product recommendations

- Regional Focus: Prioritized high-growth developing Asian economies (projected \(4.5 - 4.6\%\) growth vs. \(1.4 - 1.5\%\) in advanced economies)- Southeast Asia: Established physical retail and e-commerce presence as key bridgehead market- Middle East & Africa: Expanded ANTA's footprint into UAE, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Egypt, and Kenya- Mature Markets: Adopted flexible approach through strategic distributor partnerships and community engagement

- Core Approach: Maintaining "Single-focus, Multi-brand, Globalization" strategy with long-termism commitment- Priority Focus: Continued concentration on "must-win battle" centered on two major brands: ANTA and FILA- Growth Philosophy: Balancing innovation, market expansion, and operational efficiency to drive sustainable development

- ANTA Brand: Deepening innovative transformation through new business formats and vertical stores; continued investment in product technology- FILA Brand: Strengthening presence in golf and tennis categories; building robust core product lineup while strategically diversifying store formats- Growth Brands: Maintaining high-growth momentum for DESCENTE, KOLON SPORT, and MAIA ACTIVE through channel expansion and product innovation- JACK WOLFSKIN: Developing three-to-five-year revitalization plan with newly formed joint management team; realigning product and brand framework

- Brand Autonomy: Empowering individual brands with greater independence to foster innovation and organizational agility- Talent Development: Building diverse, professional talent pipeline to support multi-brand ecosystem
- Management Philosophy: Balancing centralized strategic direction with decentralized execution capabilities
- **Digital Integration**: Continuing to connect "people, product, and place" through comprehensive digital ecosystem
- **R&D Focus**: Advancing research in high-performance materials and disruptive technologies
- **AI Strategy**: Increasing investment in artificial intelligence applications across all business functions
- **Operational Excellence**: Optimizing mid- and back-office operations under "reducing costs and increasing efficiency" principle
- **Product Innovation**: Accelerating R&D and application of sustainable materials and products
- **Green Portfolio Expansion**: Expanding environmentally friendly product ranges
- **Supply Chain Responsibility**: Reinforcing responsible management practices throughout the value chain
- **Balanced Objectives**: Pursuing simultaneous economic and social returns through sustainable business practices
Source: Company reports, Bloomberg, Bernstein estimates and analysis.

Bernstein & Co., LLC (pre April 1, 2024), Bernstein Autonomous LLP, BSG France S.A. (April 1, 2024 onwards), Sanford C. Bernstein (Hong Kong) Limited 盛博香港有限公司, Sanford C. Bernstein (Canada) Limited, Sanford C. Bernstein (India) Private Limited (SEBI registration no. INH00006378), Sanford C. Bernstein (Singapore) Private Limited and Sanford C. Bernstein Japan KK (サンフォード・C・バーンスタイン株式会社).

On April 1, 2024, Société Générale (SG) and AllianceBernstein, LP. (AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.

We value Anta on target next- twelve- month price- to- earnings (NTM P/E) multiples. We select the target NTM P/E based on company's profit growth and return on invested capital (ROIC). We believe that stocks with higher long- term growth rates and higher ROIC deserve higher multiples and so we apply incremental company premiums or discounts to individual stocks to reflect their outlook for growth and returns.
Our target price for Anta is HKD95 based on 15x NTM+1 P/E
+ Higher than expected growth of Anta and Fila brand+ New brands such as Maia Active take off faster than expected

+ Setback from multi- brand strategy and overseas businesses. The company's overseas business (Amer Sports) is large and may be affected by global economic trends+ Unfavorable cooperation relationship change with key signed athletes+ Lower- than- expected market share gain with the soft same- store sales growth (SSSG)+ Increasing competition in the industry

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index USD (JP) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex- Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex- Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:
Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 ppMarket- Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within \(+ / - 15\) pp
- Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI) index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non- Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:

- Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp- Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-10 pp- Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12- month time horizon.
